teal.render.primitives

Class Helix

  • java.lang.Object
    • teal.core.AbstractElement
      • teal.render.Rendered
        • teal.render.primitives.Line
          • teal.render.primitives.Helix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, HasID, TElement, THasPropertyChange, HasBoundingArea, HasColor, HasDirection, HasFog, HasNode3D, HasPosition, HasRotation, IsMoveable, IsPickable, TAbstractRendered, TDrawable, TRendered

    public class Helix
extends Line
    This is a Rendered object in the shape of a helix that can be used to represent a spring. It is implemented identically to Line, but with these additional parameters: - "turns" (float, number of times the helix winds around its axis) - "segments" (int, number of vertices along the entire helix) - "radius" (float, radius of the helix) Right now this thing scales only along the y-axis to get the "stretching spring" effect.
    Author:
    danziger TODO To change the template for this generated type comment go to Window - Preferences - Java - Code Style - Code Templates
    See Also:

        protected TNode3D makeNode()
        Description copied from class: Rendered
        This method builds the rendered Node3D for this object. It should be overloaded by any sub-class that uses a custom Node3D (in other words, almost all of them).

        public void render()
        Description copied from interface: TDrawable
